title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4215.20 - Starters; refund - failure of starting gate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4215.20 - Starters; refund - failure of starting gate

State Regulations
(a) When a horse starts. Every horse shall be
considered a starter when the stall gates open on the signal of the
starter. (b) Refund -- failure of
starting gate. If it be determined by the steward that a horse has been
prevented from racing because of the failure of the stall door of the starting
gate to open, the money bet on the horse shall be refunded and such horse or
horses shall be considered as scratched, notwithstanding the placing of any
remaining part of an entry or field. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4215.20

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
